resources.string: ATV (all-terrain vehicle)Adventures Goa in Ponda (has tracks spread over 5 acres with varying difficulty levels). Riders Club in Anjuna offers both natural and man-made tracks (1 km each).
Windsurfing combines the aspects of both sailing and surfing. Places Offering Windsurfing: Dona Paula jetty, Miramar, Bogmalo, Vagator, Palolem.
Located at the borders of Mhadei Wildlife Sanctuary. Goa Tourism Development Corporation has introduced whitewater river rafting here, which attracts tourists from India and abroad alike.
Requiring less speed and balance than water skiing, wakeboarding is becoming more and more popular with water sports enthusiasts. Places Offering Wakeboarding: Mobor, Rajbaga, Candolim.
Parasailing is one of the most popular adventure sports on offer in Goa.Places offering Parasailing: Arambol Beach, Baga Beach
Lively beach with water sport options
Baga is a famous beach destination in North Goa that attracts thousands of tourists and watersports lovers to its heart.
Palm-edged freshwater lake fed by springs with a beach area and food shacks, also called Vagkolam.
Calangute is a town in the North Goa district of the Indian state of Goa. It is famous for its beach, the largest in North Goa and a popular tourist destination.

Palolem Beach is situated in Canacona in southern Goa, India. The beach attracts many international tourists, mainly during the winter season between November and March. It is considered to be one of the regions most beautiful beaches.
Humble dorms and private rooms in a casual hostel offering a garden, Wi-Fi and an open-air cafe.
Refined quarters, some with sea views, in a posh convention hotel featuring pools, a spa and dining.
Peaceful area with relaxed accommodation and a buzzing, seasonal Saturday Night Market.
Casual cottages in a rural hideaway offering French dining, an outdoor pool and free breakfast.

Dudhsagar Falls is a four-tiered waterfall located on the Mandovi River in the Indian state of Goa. Dudhsagar Falls is amongst India\'s tallest waterfalls with a height of 310 m and an average width of 30 metres.
This temple had its origins in Kushasthali Cortalim, a village in Saxty (Salcette) which fell to the invading Portuguese in 1543. which was then ruled by the Hindu kings of Sonde
Shri Shantadurga Saunsthan is a private temple complex belonging to the Goud Saraswat Brahman Samaj, located 30 km from Panaji at the foothill of Kavalem village in Ponda Taluka, Goa, India.

Arch of Viceroy, also known as Viceroy\'s Arch, was erected in 1599 in Goa, India, by Viceroy Francisco da Gama, the grandson of Vasco da Gama. The arch was restored in 1954 after it faced a collapse. It is an ASI protected Monument of National Importance in Goa

Mahadeva Temple, Tambdi Surla is a 12th-century Shaivite temple in the Kadamba style dedicated to Lord Shiva and an active place of Hindu worship. It is an ASI protected Monument of National Importance in Goa.

Welcome to our family-run retreat centre and guest house, found between Anjuna and Mapusa (Map~sa) in Goa, India. We offer an array of yoga retreats, workshops, yoga teacher trainings and yoga holidays in what we feel to be one of the best locations in Goa.
St. Alex Church is situated in the most popular place and a tourist hotspot which is Calangute.

The Chapel of St. Catherine is a UNESCO World Heritage Site located in Old Goa in the same compound as Se Cathedral and the Church and Convent of St. Francis of Assisi. It was built in 1510 in the Baroque architectural style, and has a brown and white facade.
